questions.text: All are hormones that uses phospholipase C as second messenger system except?
questions.solution: Vasopressin through V1 receptor uses Phospholipase C system involving in contraction of vascular smooth muscle. Whereas Vasopressin through V2 receptor is involved in promoting aquaporins expression over cell membrane. This action is through cAMP mediated pathway

choices.text: Growth of lobulo alveolar structures of mammary gland
Expression of FSH receptors on Ovum
Stimulates contraction of lobulo alveolar structures of mammary gland

questions.text: Action of prolactin among the following is
questions.solution: prolactin involves in production and secretion of milk

questions.text: Level of the following product of thyroid follicular cell is seen least in plasma
questions.solution: Thyroglobulin is a protein secreted by thyroid follicular cells into the colloid and not into the blood stream.

choices.text: Activation and inactivation gates of pores

questions.text: Movement of molecules from ECF to ICF through carrier pores are governed by the following except
questions.solution: Pores are composed of integral membrane proteins, that form open tubes through the membrane and are always open. They don’t have gates

choices.text: They transport Na out of the cell and K into the cell
As a net of one negative charge is created outside the cell, they are called as electrogenic pump
Similar kind of transporter is involved in pumping calcium out of the cell.

questions.text: All are true about Na - K ATPase, except
questions.solution: It is electrogenic because, a net of one positive charge is moved from the interior of the cell to the exterior with each cycle of the pump. This creates positivity outside the cell.

choices.text: Ion concentration difference across a membrane

questions.text: Nernst potential describes the relationship between diffusion potential and
questions.solution: Nernst potential describes the relationship between diffusion potential and Ion concentration difference across a membrane

choices.text: Extend on each direction into two sarcomeres
Forms I band which also consists of Thin and thick filaments

questions.text: From Z disc, the actin filaments
questions.solution: Extend on each direction into two sarcomeres.

questions.text: Role of calcium in skeletal muscle contraction is
questions.solution: In the presence of large amount of calcium ions, the inhibitory effect of troponin-tropomyosin on actin filament is inhibited leading to activation of actin

choices.text: It contracts against a maximum load
Velocity of contraction and load applied have no correlation

questions.text: A skeletal muscle contract rapidly when
questions.solution: A skeletal muscle contract rapidly when It contracts against no load to a state of full contraction. The time is 0.1 second for an average muscle

questions.text: Normal PR interval is
questions.solution: It takes 0.16 second for a QRS complex to appear after a P wave. Normal P wave duration 0.08 second. Normal PR interval is 0.12 to 0.20 seconds

questions.text: Atrial contraction contributing ventricular filling is
Work done by the heart to pump the blood in to arteries during each contraction is called as
questions.solution: Stroke work output of the heart is the amount of energy that the heart converts to work during each heartbeat while pumping blood into the arteries. It consists of two components. Volume pressure work + Kinetic energy of blood flow.

questions.text: Forces tending to move fluid outward a capillary are all except
questions.solution: plasma colloid osmotic pressure tends to move fluid inward of a capillary

questions.text: All of the following ions cause vasodilatation when their intracellular values increase except
questions.solution: Calcium ion when increased in blood causes vasoconstriction.

questions.text: Average volume of water lost in stools every day is

choices.text: Measured with extracellular fluid volume and blood volume
Measured with Inulin and radio labelled albumin

questions.text: True bout interstitial fluid volume measurement is
questions.solution: Measured with Inulin (ECF) and radio labelled albumin (plasma volume)

questions.text: Adrenal insufficiency causes
questions.solution: adrenal insufficiency as well as diuretics overuse causes Hyponatremia – dehydration.

questions.text: The following mechanism causes edema by blockage of lymph return
questions.solution: Burns leads to protein loss from denuded skin area and increasing capillary permeability. Cirrhosis leads to failure of protein production. Prolonged ischemia leads to increased capillary permeability.

choices.text: Total renal blood flow / renal plasma flow
Renal plasma flow / renal blood flow

questions.text: Filtration fraction is
The following substance has filterability of 1.0
questions.solution: Water, sodium, glucose, inulin has filterability of 1.0

questions.text: The first cell that can be identified as belonging to RBC is
The following genotypes have neither Anti A nor Anti b agglutinins
questions.solution: Genotype AB has A and B agglutinogen on RBC membrane and no agglutinins in blood

questions.text: The following factors are dependent on Vitamin K for their production except
During expiration, pleural pressure will be
Functional residual capacity in normal physiological condition is
questions.solution:
• 3500 ml – inspiratory capacity
  • 2300 ml – Functional residual capacity
  • 500 ml – Tidal volume
  • 1100 ml – Expiratory volume

questions.text: The primary stimulus for chemo sensitive neurons of brain involved in respiration is

choices.text: Receptors of aortic and carotid bodies

questions.text: All the following are chemoreceptors except
questions.solution: vestibular receptors mechanoreceptors

questions.text: Golgi tendon organ senses
Primary motor cortex is represented by Brodmann's area
questions.solution:
1,2,3 – Somatic area I

5,7 – Somatic association area

6 – Pre motor area

questions.text: Equilibrium and posture are controlled by
In a patient with pre renal azotemia, GFR is chiefly determined by all the following factors except
questions.solution: Intraglomerular oncotic pressure is the least influencing factor in a pre-renal azotemia although in intrinsic renal, it plays a significant role in GFR regulation

questions.text: Complete absence of urine production is seen in all the following conditions except
questions.solution: Acute kidney injury. In all other conditions mentioned above in the question, along with complete urinary tract obstruction, there will be complete anuria.

choices.text: Internal jugular vein is preferred for JVP measurement
External jugular vein should not be used to discriminate between high and low central venous pressure
A distance greater than 2.5 cm at 60-degree reclination is considered abnormal
Use of sternal angle as reference point leads to overestimation of JVP.

questions.text: Regarding measurement of Venous Pressures, true statement among the following is
questions.solution:
• Internal jugular vein is preferred for JVP measurement
  • External jugular vein has been used to discriminate between high and low central venous pressure
  • A distance greater than 4.5 cm at 60-degree reclination is considered abnormal
  • Use of sternal angle as reference point leads to overestimation of JVP

questions.text: Phase IV korotkoff's sound is considered as marker of diastolic blood pressure in which of the following condition?
questions.solution: In chronic as well as severe aortic regurgitation, there will be enhanced diastolic run off; as a result, very low diastolic blood pressures (0 mm hg) can also be recorded. In these instances, Phase IV and V sounds should be recorded.

questions.text: Anacrotic pulse is seen in
questions.solution: Aortic stenosis is seen with anacrotic pulse which is manifested by slow upstroke to a reduced peak of pulse wave.

choices.text: Measured between atmospheric pressure and intra pleural pressure
Measured between atmospheric pressure and intra alveolar pressure

questions.text: True regarding elastic recoil pressure of lung is
questions.solution: transmural pressure (intra alveolar – intra pleural pressure) needs to be positive to keep the lung inflated. This difference is also called elastic recoil pressure of lungs. It increases with lung volume

choices.text: Amount of blood transiting the alveolar capillaries.

questions.text: In physiological conditions, oxygen movement across alveolar capillary membrane is limited by
questions.solution: Uptake of alveolar oxygen is physiologically limited by amount of blood transiting the alveolar capillaries rather than by other diffusion limiting factor. Hence oxygen uptake by the pulmonary capillary is said to be perfusion limited.

questions.text: True statement about lung function in moderate obesity is
questions.solution: In moderate obesity, the outward recoil of chest wall is blunted by the weight of chest wall fat. Lung recoil tendency remains normal and it dominates over the reduced outward recoil of chest wall leading to fall in functional residual capacity.

questions.text: Integrity of blood brain barrier is compromised in
questions.solution: Ischemia, Metabolic derangements, Infections and trauma disrupts the competency of blood brain barrier leading to influx of fluid and solutes into brain. This is called as vasogenic edema.

questions.text: The target level of cerebral perfusion pressure in mm Hg to be maintained in patients with elevated intracranial pressure is
questions.solution: ≥ 60 mm hg is the goal for maintenance of cerebral perfusion pressure along with an ICP target of < 20 mm Hg

questions.text: Specificity of nerve fibers for transmitting only one modality of sensation is called
questions.solution: Specificity of nerve fibers for transmitting only one modality of sensation is called Labelled line principle

questions.text: Vibration is sensed by
questions.solution:
• Merkel’s cell – fine touch and discriminative touch
  • Pacinian corpuscle – vibration
  • Meissner’s corpuscles – touch
  • Ruffini endings – touch, pressure

questions.text: Position sense is carried by
questions.solution: Dorsal column – medial lemniscus system carries touch, vibration and proprioception (position sense)

questions.text: Retinal cell that first gets exposed to the light coming after passing through the lens is
questions.solution: After light passes through the lens system of the eye and then through the vitreous humor, it enters the retina from inside of the eye, that is it passes through the ganglion cell layer and then through plexiform and nuclear layer. Finally it reaches rods and cones.

choices.text: Long chain organic substances containing nitrogen

questions.text: Sour taste is produced by
questions.solution:
• Sodium - salt
  • Hydrogen - sour
  • Long chain organic substances containing nitrogen - bitter
  • Alkaloids - bitter

questions.text: The enzyme responsible for breakdown of starches for the first time in GIT is
questions.solution: salivary alpha amylase is the enzyme that acts on starches in the oral cavity, breaking the starches to polysaccharides.

questions.text: Parasympathetic activation of large intestine leads to
Water transport across intestinal membrane is
questions.solution: Water is transported through intestinal membrane entirely by diffusion. This diffusion obeys osmosis and not fick’s law.

questions.text: Adrenaline, noradrenaline and dopamine act through
questions.solution: catecholamines (epinephrine, norepinephrine and dopamine) act through G protein coupled receptors, which span the cell membrane 7 times; hence also referred to as seven pass (seven helix) or serpentine receptors

choices.text: Decreasing the activity of suprachiasmatic nuclei
Blocking the release of norepinephrine from sympathetic nerve terminals

questions.text: Exposure to darkness leads to increased melatonin secretion. It is brought about by:
questions.solution: Increased N-acetyl transferase and hydroxy indole-o-methyl (HOM) transferase during darkness leads to increased melatonin secretion.
